meanings.sent1: The snake will constrict its prey to catch it.
meanings.sent2: She used a belt to constrict the waist of her dress.
meanings.sent3: The constricting traffic made him late for the meeting.
meanings.sent4: His fear seemed to constrict his chest, making it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent5: The constricting grip of the handcuffs felt suffocating.

meanings.sent1: The rules constrict our freedom to act as we please.
meanings.sent2: They decided to constrict the budget to save money.
meanings.sent3: The constricting regulations made it difficult to start a business.
meanings.sent4: Her parents always tried to constrict her choices, but she remained determined.
meanings.sent5: The constricting boundaries of the town limited their exploration.

meanings.sent1: He had to constrict the bag to fit all his clothes inside.
meanings.sent2: The python will constrict its prey before swallowing it whole.
meanings.sent3: The constricting feeling in his chest made him anxious.
meanings.sent4: The constricting grip of the vice made it hard to open.
meanings.sent5: She could feel the constricting pressure of the bandage on her arm.
